review: Love my Fire TV.  Have had it over a month now and it works beautifully.  It was really quite simple to set up.  Really no learning curve required.  I had never had a "streaming" device before and as usual Amazon makes it a joy to use.  (Have several Kindles and they, too, are a joy to use and easy to set up.)  Love all the apps such as Netflix already loaded and ready to use.  Also love the simple way the content is set up.  Again, no learning curve required.  Couldn't be more pleased.  Amazon has another home run in the Fire TV.
author: kate13

review: I was hesitant to get this box at first, but then I saw the prices of the Apple TV 2, which are the most popular XBMC boxes. I looked online to see how hard it was to install XBMC, and seeing how it wasn't too difficult, I bit the bullet and ordered the Fire. It took me about 2 days of tinkering and reading/watching tutorials on how to install XBMC, but now I have the hang of it. Some of the boxes on ebay are about $140 with XBMC installed. That's great for a lot of people since they sell well, but I like learning new things, so I gave this a shot and it was worth it. XBMC works great, and as long as you have the right channels you can cut the cord if you wanted.My only complaint is the MLB app is bad. Constant hiccups and stuttering on this app only. Any other app I have tried works perfectly but I get inconsistent streams on the MLB app. Also there's no HBO Go app yet, so I have to resort to the Roku to watch that. It's not worth knocking off a star from the review because this is an extremely stylish, easy to use, fast streaming box. For $100 you can't go wrong as long as you have prime and can take advantage of the video service.
